tracks.description: This is a song I associate with my grandfather; it was one of his favorites and I played it at his celebration of life ceremony

Blue Rondo a La Turk was one of the first jazz pieces I really listened to, so I listened to it a lot when we made yearly visits to New Mexico. Many of my early experiences with jazz are associated with New Mexico.

I discovered this song while looking for pieces to play on French Horn, and the mood of this piece really fits with New Mexico. It's laid-back but lively at the same time, which I think well encapulates the desert attitude
My dad used to play this song for my sisters and I throughout our childhood, so it is very special to me. It reminds me of New Mexico because that's his birthplace and the home of his grandparents
